files.description: Defines the Python package metadata, dependencies (e.g., numpy, matplotlib), and console script entrypoint for a deterministic run that writes fixed outputs.
Documents how to install and run the deterministic entrypoint, describes the fixed output files and the metadata captured.
Exposes the public package API and version information for the deterministic runner library.
Implements the deterministic command-line entrypoint that seeds RNGs, runs the computation, and writes /outputs/results.json and /outputs/figure.png with stable filenames.
Provides utilities to set deterministic behavior across random, numpy, and hash seeds while avoiding time-dependent behavior.
Collects a small reproducibility metadata block including git hash if available, Python version, and installed package versions.
Handles creation of the outputs directory and writing results.json with fixed keys and figure.png in a deterministic manner.
Generates a deterministic matplotlib figure saved to /outputs/figure.png with fixed styling and content derived from the run results.

missionDescription: Implement a deterministic entrypoint (seed RNGs; avoid time-dependent filenames) that writes /outputs/results.json (fixed keys) and /outputs/figure.png, plus a small metadata block (git hash if available, python version, package versions).
missionSuccessCriteria: Complete the urgent task identified by Meta-Coordinator

Curated insight (actionability 8-9/10): Directly enables a minimal runnable computational skeleton with regression-friendly outputs (fixed-schema JSON + a figure). Determinism makes results stable across cycles, supports automated checks, a...
